raw_response: {"answer_index": 1, "answer_text": "Resistance to increase gonorrhea cocci (Neisseria gonorrhoeae), is not recommended as first-line treatment", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "Fluoroquinolones are bactericidal, not bacteriostatic (option 0 is incorrect). Resistance among Neisseria gonorrhoeae has increased, so fluoroquinolones are no longer first-line for gonorrhea (option 1 is correct). They are mainly cleared renally, so dose adjustment is needed in renal failure (option 2 is incorrect). They are active against Pseudomonas, and are not contraindicated in neutropenic fever (option 3 is incorrect)." }
